filters.name: age
filters.question: What year were you born?
filters.why: In the USA, age is a 'protected class', meaning that it is illegal to discriminate against someone on the basis of their age.

filters.name: gender
filters.question: What is your gender identity? Please choose all that apply.
filters.why: A CMU study found that simulated male profiles received ads that were associated with $200,000 jobs six times more often than the simulated female profiles.

filters.name: race
filters.question: What is your race/ethnicity? Please choose all that apply.
filters.why: See Latanya Sweeney's analysis of racial discrimination in online advertising.

filters.name: religion
filters.question: What is your religion? Please choose all that apply.
filters.why: In the USA, religion is a 'protected class', meaning that it is illegal to discriminate against someone on the basis of their faith.

filters.name: country
filters.question: Where do you live?
filters.why: In the USA, national origin is a 'protected class', meaning that it is illegal to discriminate against someone on the basis of where they're from.
